meanings.definition: Misprices (verb): to set the wrong price on something
meanings.sent1: The store misprices the new video game, making it cheaper than it should be.
meanings.sent2: She often misprices items at the garage sale, causing confusion among buyers.
meanings.sent3: The robot misprices all the items in the store, leading to a hilarious shopping spree.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions misprices the value of hard work, making it seem less important.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand misprices reality, turning ordinary objects into gold.

meanings.definition: Misprices (noun): instances where the wrong price is set on something
meanings.sent1: There were several misprices on the grocery shelves, causing customers to get great deals.
meanings.sent2: The manager quickly corrected the misprices on the products to avoid any confusion.
meanings.sent3: The misprices at the antique store made it a popular spot for bargain hunters.
meanings.sent4: The misprices in the auction house created a frenzy among collectors bidding for items.
meanings.sent5: The misprices in the online store attracted many savvy shoppers looking for discounts.
